intro: Axinaea lepidota, commonly known as the silver axinaea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Colombia and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels. Its leaves are typically ovate to elliptic in shape and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Axinaea lepidota is often found growing in humid, shaded environments within montane forests.
